answers.answer: I would go to the hospital. Extreme swelling like that can be a sign of preeclampsia and it could happen suddenly. My doctor is watching me to see if I develope it because of my hands being swollen and seeing spots.. He told me if the swelling got worse to go straight to the hospital.
But, if you do have it then they would induce you. That's the only way to get rid of the preeclampsia.
^^^^what she said you should go in right away to have that checked bc if you have it they need to induce you asap.
Could it be anything else?! Im headed to the hospital now

It honestly sounds like pre eclampsia, a friend of mine had it & got real swollen. She had to be induced because of it bc if it gets to bad, that's the only way to make it go away is to have the baby.
or else it can be harmful to you & baby keep us updated!
^^ Yep. Good luck though! Keep us updated.

I've gone to the hospital for extreme swelling, to then point where it hurts to walk, roll out of bed, do anything. The labor and delivery unit at my hospital says the doctors don't really look too much into preeclampsia with swelling any more, they told me its just part of pregnancy, my bp was fine and no protein in my urine, so it was completely ruled out for me. I was also told it can take up to 2 weeks for the swelling to do completely away after baby is born. Good luck !
I was just told it was common they didnt send meto labor and delivery

I was in the e.r. lol my bad, I went to labor and delivery the other day because I thought my water was leaking but it wasn't, and the nurse said something about my legs, feet and ankles being so swollen and I told her how long its been like that and when I went to the e.r. and that's what she told me.

well I just got back from the hospital, same thing was happening to me. my blood pressure was high and protein was detected in my urine. they monitored me for a few hours after about 4 hours my blood pressure went back down. so they sent me home. told me to get rest. I have a follow up in a few days. hopefully everything goes well with you too<3

question: Im 37 weeks and my legs, feet, ankles, and hands are so swollen i want to cry everytime i move, i havent been told i have high blood pressure so im not sure whats causing this, but could i be induced due to this painful swelling
title: induced due to swelling?!
